text: Permanent exemption from Ramadan fast may be occasioned by
explanation: Even though fasting in Ramadan is mandatory upon every functional and able Muslim, Allah Almighty has pardoned and excused certain people from the act of fasting if they are unable to fast due to certain legitimate reasons. Individuals facing senility and old age are essentially exempt from fasting. With old age comes weakness, terminal illnesses, loss of mental faculties and extreme fragility, hence, it is believed that people in their old age are not required to fast at the cost of their health.

explanation: Salat al-Istikhara, which translates to prayer of seeking counsel, is a prayer recited by muslims who are in need of guidance from Almighty Allah when facing a decision in their life.

explanation: The Tahajjud is a special night prayer which is recommended(but not compulsory) for all muslims. Known as the best among the voluntary prayers, the Tahajjud is prayed after Isha (the obligatory nightly prayer) and before Fajr(the obligatory morning prayer).

text: The period between the advent of Islam in Arabia is referred to as Jahiliyyah because Arabia
